intro: Malcolmia mongolica, commonly known as Mongolian malcolmia, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves, often growing in dry, sandy environments. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species.
